title: Saulteaux (1900) Portions
description: The Saulteaux (also written Salteaux, Saulteau and other variants), otherwise known as the Plains Ojibwe, are a First Nations band government in Ontario, Manitoba, Saskatchewan, Alberta and British Columbia, Canada. They are a branch of the Ojibwe who pushed west. They formed a mixed culture of woodlands and plains Indigenous customs and traditions.

language.name: Western Ojibwa
language.area: West from Lake Winnipeg into Saskatchewan with groups as far west as British Colombia.
